Package ra.util

Class Arith

java.lang.Object
ra.util.Arith
public class Arith
extends java.lang.Object
Since Java's primitive types cannot accurately perform operations on floating-point numbers, this tool class provides accurate floating-point operations, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and rounding..

  • Method Summary

    Returns sum two values.

    • div

      public static double div​(double v1, double v2)
      Provides (relatively) accurate division operations. When the division is inexhaustible, the accuracy is 10 digits after the decimal point, and subsequent numbers are rounded.
      Parameters:
      v1 - value1
      v2 - value2
      Returns:
      quotient of two parameters

    • div

      public static double div​(double v1, double v2, int scale)
      Provides (relatively) precise division operations. When the division is inexhaustible, the precision is specified by the scale parameter, and the subsequent figures are rounded.
      Parameters:
      v1 - value1
      v2 - value2
      scale - Indicates that it needs to be accurate to a few decimal places.
      Returns:
      quotient of two parameters

    • round

      public static double round​(double v, int scale)
      Provide accurate decimal rounding processing.
      Parameters:
      v - value
      scale - keep a few digits after the decimal point
      Returns:
      rounded result

    • floor

      public static double floor​(double value, int scale)
      Provide accurate decimal places to be discarded unconditionally.
      Parameters:
      value - value
      scale - scale
      Returns:
      the largest (closest to positive infinity) floating-point value that less than or equal to the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer..
